intro: Scleranthus sprengelii, commonly known as the narrowleaf sand-plant, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Scleranthus sprengelii is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
